alert.note: Alert for Sacramento (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 8:47AM PST until January 01 at 11:15PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sacramento has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Sacramento County in central California... * Until 1115 PM PST Sunday. * At 847 AM PST, Law enforcement, emergency management, and media reported widespread flash flooding along the Cosumnes River with roads underwater, including California Highway 99. Flash flooding is ongoing. Local officials are working to assess the extent of the flooding. Please stay out of the area! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Highway 99 between Galt and Elk Grove, Wilton, Galt, Bruceville, and Thornton. This includes the following streams and drainages... Dry Creek, Deer Creek, Cosumnes River Overflow, Mokelumne River, Cosumnes River, North Fork Badger Creek and Badger Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
